dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5107 RH: CLEAN DC Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Clyde (for himself, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Stauber, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mrs. Luna, Mr. Crane, Ms. Boebert, Mr. Roy, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mrs. Biggs of South Carolina, Mrs. Harshbarger, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Gill of Texas, Mr. Amodei of Nevada, Mr. Nehls, Ms. Van Duyne, Mr. Burchett, Mr. Davidson, Mr. Bean of Florida, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Brecheen, Mr. Burlison, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Biggs of Arizona, Mr. Self, Mr. Begich, Mr. Ogles, Mr. Cuellar, and Mr. Arrington) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on September 3, 2025

form.official-title: To repeal the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022 enacted by the District of Columbia Council.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Common-Sense Law Enforcement and Accountability Now in DC Act of 2025 or the CLEAN DC Act of 2025.

section.header: Repeal of certain provisions of Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022

subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (b), the Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Amendment Act of 2022 (D.C. Law 24–345) is hereby repealed, and any provision of law amended or repealed by such Act is restored or revived as if such Act had not been enacted into law.
The repeal under subsection (a) shall not apply with respect to—

paragraph.text: subtitle S of title I of such Act (sec. 5–365.01 et seq., D.C. Official Code); and
subtitle A of title I of such Act (sec. 5–125.01 et seq. and sec. 5–302, D.C. Official Code).

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
